intro: Freycinetia bicolor, commonly known as the red-veined arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Pandanaceae family and is characterized by its striking, lance-shaped leaves with distinctive red veins. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by three-winged fruits. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine and as a source of starch. Freycinetia bicolor thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests.
